result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert G. Oglesby Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Robert G. Oglesby Jr. was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT w/Cts.3&5 and file 14CF606 but CONSECUTIVE to 11CF449.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges (cash bond, if any 13CF778, shall be applied).
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Victims or Co-Defts, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.
*  Make monthly payments for court obligations and supervision fees.
Do not possess or use alcohol or controlled substance verified through random breathalyzer and UA tests.  Do not conduct any business with any pawn shops or enter any such business.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  
Counts 1 & 5 - DE is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  (**see below)
Count 3 - DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP forthwith; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 1 year Extended Supervision. (**see below)
**All counts in 14CF606 & 14CF715 are Concurrent with each other, but Consecutive to 11CF449.
DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning  & Voting Acknowledgement given.  If any cash bond balance remains in 14CF778 upon applying to 14CF606 it is to be applied.
Sentencing on 09-03-2015 11:00 am confirmed with Atty Rufo
Due to courts unavailbility today Sentencing to be rescheduled with notice to parties.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Andrea Rufo.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 9 and 13 - Dismissed on State motion, to be read in.  Counts 2, 4, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 12, 14, 15, and 16 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1, 2, and 5 - Pleas of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 7/21/15 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

13CF778/14CF606/14CF715
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appears by video conference with Attorney Andrea Rufo who appears in person.  Clerk: PT
Atty Zievers is currently in another court and Atty Rufo states cases will be resolved and requests a plea date for all 3 files.  Parties agree to a Plea Hearing on 6/11/15 at 9:40 AM for all files.  State will prepare a writ.
filed by Atty Andrea Rufo
Atty Andrea Rufo
Status conference on May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Due to unavailability of the court; Status Conf. rescheduled to 5/21/15 at 8:30 AM as Atty Karls has not been able to meet with DE and will be assigning a new public defender due to her retirement.  Video Conf. arrangement to be made and if case is resolved at that time then the new attorney will notify the DA's Office to prepare a Writ so he may appear.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appears by video conference from Dodge Correctional and with Atty Karls and Atty Zievers.  Clerk: PT
Atty Karls states she has a phone conf. scheduled with DE next Tuesday and requests one more status date before the trial date.   Atty Karls is to notify the court if case is not resolved at next hearing so video conf. can be arranged and if resolved she is to notify the DA's Office so a writ can be prepared.  Status Conf. on 3/19/15 at 8:30 AM.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery -filed by ADA, Margaret Drees  kmk

13CF778/14CF606/14CF715
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Fred Zievers in 13CF778 and Attorney Val Karls in 14CF606 & 14CF715.  Clerk: PT
Atty Karls states ADA Gabriele is no longer assigned to these cases so they are requesting additional time to reach a resolution.  Court sets 14CF606 over for trial and a status date on the other 2 files.  Scheduling order given on 14CF606.  Atty Karls requests DE be allowed to appear by phone at the next status date and if there will be a plea then she will notify the DA so a writ can be prepared for the next hearing.  Status Conf. on 2/18/15 at 11:00 AM for all 3 files.  Jury Status on 6/4/15 at 1:00 PM and Jury Trial on 6/8/15 at 8:30 AM in 14CF606.
